oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Microscopic investigations of alpha emitters close to the N = Z line
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHARANA, JP
BHAGWAT, A
GAMBHIR, YK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MEAN-FIELD-THEORY

FINITE NUCLEI
HALF-LIVES

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The results of fully microscopic calculations for the alpha-decay half-lives of light alpha emitters close to the N = Z line are presented. The ground-state properties are calculated in the relativistic mean field (RMF) approach which reproduce the experiment well, as expected. The alpha-daughter nucleus potential is then calculated in the double folding model using the density dependent M3Y nucleon-nucleon interaction and the RMF nuclear density distributions. This potential in turn is used to calculate the alpha-decay half-lives in the WKB approximation. The results closely agree with the corresponding values obtained by using the available phenomenological expressions as well as with the experiment. The alpha-decay half-lives of a few Te, I, Xe, Cs, and Ba isotopes have also been predicted.
